events.title: Vasco da Gama Arrives in India
events.description: Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama reaches the shores of Calicut (now Kozhikode) in India, establishing the first direct maritime route from Europe to Asia.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of a new era in global trade and European colonial expansion into Asia.

events.title: Frank Winfield Woolworth Opens First Successful 'Five Cent Store'
events.description: Frank Winfield Woolworth opens the first successful 'Five Cent Store' in Lancaster, Pennsylvania, pioneering a new retail concept.
events.significance: Woolworth's store is considered the origin of the modern retail chain store concept.

events.title: Charles Lindbergh Completes First Solo Nonstop Transatlantic Flight
events.description: Charles Lindbergh lands in Paris after flying nonstop from New York, completing the first solo nonstop transatlantic airplane flight.
events.significance: Lindbergh's flight demonstrated the possibilities of aviation and greatly boosted public interest and investment in air travel.

events.title: East and West Germany Hold First Free Elections
events.description: East Germany holds its first free parliamentary elections since World War II as part of steps leading to German reunification.
events.significance: These elections were a key step in the process of German reunification, symbolizing the end of the Cold War division of Europe.
